reference.text: propulsion of air-cushion vehicles B60V1/14; specially adapted for submarines, other than nuclear propulsion, B63G; specially adapted for torpedoes F42B19/00

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass, the indexing codes B63B2201/00 - B63B2241/00 are to be used for relevant technical information concerning particular or unusual use, materials, design, methods or means
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

Groups B63H1/00 - B63H25/52 are incomplete pending reclassification of documents from groups B63B2701/00 - B63B2770/00.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: Propulsive elements directly acting on water

reference.text: jet propulsion B63H11/00

CPC-specific-text.text: using Magnus effect

title-part.text: with rotation axis substantially at right angles to propulsive direction

CPC-specific-text.text: with partially immersed nutating or ondulated disks, e.g. wobble plates

title-part.text: of Voith Schneider type, i.e. with blades extending axially from a disc-shaped rotary body

CPC-specific-text.text: with non-mechanical control of individual blades, e.g. electric or hydraulic control

title-part.text: with rotation axis substantially in propulsive direction

CPC-specific-text.text: Single or multiple threaded helicoidal screws, or the like, comprising foils extending over a substantial angle; Archimedean screws
with helicoidal foils projecting from outside surfaces of floating rotatable bodies, e.g. rotatable, cylindrical bodies
with helicoidal foils projecting from inside surfaces of rotating shrouds; Archimedean screws

reference.text: pitch changing B63H3/00

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising blades of two or more different types, e.g. different lengths

title-part.text: having a shrouding ring attached to blades

CPC-specific-text.text: Hubless propellers, e.g. peripherally driven shrouds with blades projecting from the shrouds' inside surfaces

title-part.text: with means for diminishing cavitation, e.g. supercavitation

CPC-specific-text.text: Surfacing propellers, i.e. propellers specially adapted for operation at the water surface, with blades incompletely submerged, or piercing the water surface from above in the course of each revolution
each blade being constituted by a surface enclosing an empty space, e.g. forming a closed loop

title-part.text: Other means for improving propeller efficiency

CPC-specific-text.text: Propeller hub caps with fins having a pitch different from pitch of propeller blades, or a helix hand opposed to the propellers' helix hand
Injection of gas into fluid flow to propellers, or around propeller blades

title-part.text: Flaps, pistons, or the like, reciprocating in propulsive direction

CPC-specific-text.text: with tracks substantially parallel to propulsive direction
having paddles mounted in fixed relation to tracks, or to track members
having paddles movably mounted on the track or on track members, e.g. articulated, or with means for cyclically controlling the paddles' angular position or orientation
with tracks oriented transverse to propulsive direction

title-part.text: Moving-wave propellers, i.e. wherein the propelling means comprise a flexible undulating structure
characterised solely by flotation properties, e.g. drums

reference.text: aircraft propellers B64C11/30; rotors of turbines F01D7/00; axial wind motors F03D7/022; axial-flow pumps F04D29/00

CPC-specific-text.text: with individually adjustable blades
comprising means for locking blades in position
Detecting or transmitting propeller-blade pitch angle
characterised by self-adjusting pitch, e.g. by means of springs, centrifugal forces, hydrodynamic forces

title-part.text: actuated by control element coaxial with propeller shaft, e.g. the control element being rotary

reference.text: B63H3/002 takes precedence, fluid actuated B63H3/081

title-part.text: characterised by use of non-mechanical actuating means, e.g. electrical

reference.text: B63H3/002 takes precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: actuated by control element coaxial with the propeller shaft
the control element being axially reciprocatable
with annular cylinder and piston
the control element having means for preventing rotation together with the propeller
using gaseous fluids, e.g. steam or air
characterised by supply of fluid actuating medium to control element, e.g. of hydraulic fluid to actuator co-rotating with the propeller

title-part.text: characterised by having pitch control conjoint with propulsion plant control
the pitch being adjustable only when propeller is stationary

reference.text: B63H3/002 takes precedence

title-part.text: Arrangements on vessels of propulsion elements directly acting on water

CPC-specific-text.text: Front propulsors, i.e. propellers, paddle wheels, or the like substantially arranged ahead of the vessels' midship section

title-part.text: of paddle wheels, e.g. of stern wheels

CPC-specific-text.text: of Voith Schneider type

title-part.text: movably mounted with respect to the hull, e.g. having means to reposition paddle wheel assembly, or to retract paddle or to change paddle attitude

reference.text: forming part of outboard units

CPC-specific-text.text: or Z-drives
using non-azimuthing podded propulsor units, i.e. podded units without means for rotation about a vertical axis, e.g. rigidly connected to the hull

title-part.text: of coaxial type, e.g. of counter-rotative type

CPC-specific-text.text: of co-rotative type, i.e. rotating in the same direction, e.g. twin propellers
with drive shafts of second or further propellers co-axially passing through hub of first propeller, e.g. counter-rotating tandem propellers with co-axial drive shafts

title-part.text: movably mounted with respect to hull, e.g. adjustable in direction

CPC-specific-text.text: , e.g. podded azimuthing thrusters
outboard units or Z-drives B63H20/00;

reference.text: movably mounted for steering purposes only,

CPC-specific-text.text: rudders carrying propellers

title-part.text: Connections of sails to masts, spars, or the like

CPC-specific-text.text: Booms, or the like
Gooseneck bearings, i.e. bearings for pivotal support of booms on masts
by sliders, i.e. by shoes sliding in, or guided by channels, tracks or rails; for connecting luffs, leeches, battens, or the like to masts, spars or booms
Means for tensioning sheets, or other running rigging, adapted for being guided on rails, or the like mounted on deck, e.g. travellers or carriages with pulleys

reference.text: staying of masts B63B15/02

CPC-specific-text.text: Trapeze systems

reference.text: harnesses for windsurfers B63H8/54, B63H8/56

CPC-specific-text.text: with elastic connection to harnesses
Reefing
by furling around stays
by furling around or inside the mast
by furling around or inside the boom
using drives for actuating reefing mechanism, e.g. roll reefing drives
using sheaves being friction driven by endless ropes or by ropes having two free ends
using drums driven by winding or unwinding single ropes onto or from the drums
Spinnaker poles or rigging, e.g. combined with spinnaker handling
Boom brakes
Boom vangs
Means for stowing, or securing sails when not in use

reference.text: B63H9/1021 takes precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: using Coanda effect, i.e. the tendency of fluid jets to be attracted to nearby surfaces
using the eductor or injector pump principle, e.g. jets with by-pass fluid paths
with propulsive medium supplied from sources external to propelled vessel, e.g. water from public water supply
Arrangements of two or more jet units

title-part.text: having means to prevent foreign material from clogging fluid passage way
the propulsive medium being ambient water

CPC-specific-text.text: by means of magneto-hydro-dynamic forces
with means for adjusting or varying pump inlets, e.g. means for varying inlet cross section area
comprising means for varying pump characteristics, e.g. rotary pumps with variable pitch impellers, or adjustable stators
with axial flow, i.e. the axis of rotation being parallel to the flow direction
with combined or mixed flow, i.e. the flow direction being a combination of centrifugal flow and non-centrifugal flow, e.g. centripetal or axial flow
with two or more pump stages
having counter-rotating impellers
with radial flow
using shear forces, e.g. disc pumps or Tesla pumps

title-part.text: by means of pressure pulses applied to a column of liquid, e.g. by ignition of an air/gas or vapour mixture
having means for deflecting jet or influencing cross-section thereof

CPC-specific-text.text: having means for deflecting jet into a propulsive direction substantially parallel to the plane of the pump outlet opening
the inlet opening and the outlet opening of the pump being substantially coplanar

title-part.text: having means to increase efficiency of propulsive fluid, e.g. discharge pipe provided with means to improve the fluid flow

reference.text: B63H11/101 takes precedence

title-part.text: with bucket or clamshell-type reversing means
the propulsive medium being steam or other gas
the gas being produced by combustion

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising means for transmitting muscular power applied in oscillatory or rotary manner to a rotary input shaft of a reversing transmission, e.g. alternatively allowing for ahead or astern propulsion
by using an inverting mechanism between the handgrip and the blade, e.g. a toothed transmission
the mechanism having articulated rods
by placing the fulcrum outside the segment defined by handgrip and blade
using hand levers, cranks, pedals, or the like, e.g. water cycles, boats propelled by boat-mounted pedal cycles

by means of belts, or the like
of grooved belts, i.e. with one or more grooves in longitudinal direction of the belt

CPC-specific-text.text: or by rudders carrying jets

reference.text: steering or dynamic anchoring by deflecting or directing main propulsion jets B63H11/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Jets or thrusters substantially used for steering or dynamic anchoring only, with means for retracting, or otherwise moving to a rest position outside the water flow around the hull

title-part.text: Steering or slowing-down by deflection of propeller slipstream otherwise than by rudder
Slowing-down means not otherwise provided for
Parts for steering not otherwise provided for
